meanings.definition: To make something resemble or conform to the characteristics of Prussia.
meanings.sent1: She started prussianizing her room by organizing everything in a strict and orderly manner.
meanings.sent2: The government was prussianizing the education system to mirror that of Prussia.
meanings.sent3: The cat prussianized the living room by arranging all the toys in a neat row.
meanings.sent4: His strict diet and exercise routine prussianized his body, making him disciplined and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The artist prussianized the painting by using only shades of gray, reminiscent of Prussian architecture.

meanings.definition: The act of imposing Prussian customs or practices on a group or society.
meanings.sent1: The prussianizing of the region led to the adoption of strict military traditions.
meanings.sent2: The prussianizing of the school system brought about a focus on discipline and punctuality.
meanings.sent3: The prussianizing of the office dress code resulted in everyone wearing formal attire.
meanings.sent4: The prussianizing of the community event made it highly organized and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The prussianizing of the town's architecture gave it a distinct and imposing look.
